V.iii.11.4.c
.  Example 3: Rating Decision Involving Complications of Diabetes Mellitus
Situation
:  The Veteran underwent a below-the-knee amputation due to complications of diabetes mellitus.  In addition
his diabetes mellitus requires
more than one daily injection of insulin
restricted diet, and
regulation of activities
his episodes of ketoacidosis require weekly visits to the diabetic care provider, but
there is no progressive loss of weight and strength.
Result
:  Evaluate the diabetes mellitus at 100 percent and award SMC (k) for anatomical loss of a foot.  Since the below-the-knee amputation is secondary to diabetes mellitus, and is considered a compensable complication (in lieu of progressive loss of weight and strength), to warrant the 100-percent evaluation, it would be pyramiding to assign a separate 40-percent evaluation for the amputation.
Note
:  If compensable complications are not considered in reaching the 100- percent evaluation, they may be separately evaluated.
